__TOC__

At this time this page is just a raw listing of links to various sites and pages on the internet about how open-source software has been used in schools and the advantages of doing so, including the fundamental reasons for considering it, case studies, and in-depth descriptions of very wide-scale deployments.

* INaccess: Over 200,000 Linux desktops in schools across Indiana - http://www.doe.state.in.us/INaccess/
* Beacon School: Capabilities-driven deployment, written by Technology Coordinator - http://www.beaconschool.org/~clehmann/opensource.html
* Open Source in Education: A university paper on the issues and implications - http://portfolio.umaine.edu/~hartt/OS%20in%20Education.pdf
* SchoolForge: Portal for software, news, and case studies relating to education - http://www.schoolforge.net/
* Why Open Source in Schools: A short explanation - http://edge-op.org/grouch/schools.html
* Benefits of Open Source in Education: Notes from an Australian industry group - http://www.osv.org.au/index.cgi?tid=5
* Open Source Savings for a School District: Cost-driven case study for Noxon school districts - http://spidertools.com/oss.php
* Open Source and School: A list of OSS applications useful for educators from Springfield Township High School - http://www.sdst.org/shs/library/opensource.html
* K12OpenSource: Community site for educators to learn about open-source from each other - http://www.k12opensource.com/
* Open Source Software Solutions for K-12: Making Decisions About Open Source Software (OSS) for K-12, for administrators, technicians, teachers, students, and parents/guardians - http://www.netc.org/openoptions/
* Schools Save Big with Open Source: Cost-driven case-study summaries - http://www.networkworld.com/weblogs/smb/2006/012953.html
* How open source saved a school district's IT department: Cost-driven case study - http://www.linuxworld.com/news/2007/092107-california-school-it.html?fsrc=rss-linux-news
* Open Schools Alliance: Portal for issues, arguments, and explanations of open-source as it pertains to schools and their potential - http://www.openschoolsalliance.org/
